prompt: What to do if I can not find my answer anywhere, including FAQ? ->
completion: Email Student Payroll at studentpayroll@minerva.edu. END

prompt: I cannot access/have issues logging into Paycom for WS Fall 2022, what should I do? ->
completion: Wait until Friday, September 23rd, 2022. If you still cannot access Paycom, email studentpayroll@minerva.edu. We’re working on enabling Paycom access to all students until then. END

prompt: My Paycom account says that “Your account is not active”. How can I log in? ->
completion: We will activate your account in Paycom before the deadline to submit your hours, and email your login credentials. Please check your email for your login information from Paycom. In case your account has not been activated on time, and you didn’t receive your login information, email Student Payroll. END

prompt: I’ve been onboarded into Paycom but still can’t login. ->
completion: Please make sure to login using the employee login page for Paycom. The link to the onboarding email will expire once we activate your account. END

prompt: I have already been onboarded and used Paycom before. Do I need to do the I-9 checklist again? ->
completion: No, you do not. Just make sure you review how to submit hours. END

prompt: I cannot enter hours in Paycom, what should I do? ->
completion: Email Student Payroll. END

prompt: I am missing my payments from my summer internship, what should I do? ->
completion: Do not enter hours for your summer internship; otherwise those hours will count towards your WS hours limit. Instead, email student payroll explaining the issue. END

prompt: How can I change my Paycom login credentials? ->
completion: Go to “Information”, then click “Change Password or Username”. END

prompt: I have not been onboarded in Paycom yet since I am waiting to get the SSN. What should I do? ->
completion: You can enter all your worked hours once you get into Paycom. Please enter hours from previous work periods in the current, most up-to-date, pay period timecard and indicate time period work and work details for manager approval. Hours entered in old pay periods will be not captured and paid. Please view the WS calendar if you’re not sure which pay period is in the current time period. END

prompt: I have applied for an SSN, but I am not sure when to submit the Form for Paycom initial Information? ->
completion: You can submit it anytime before you get an SSN, and you should receive an invite from Paycom until when you get the SSN. If you do not receive an invite from Paycom until then, email Student Payroll. END

prompt: I have submitted the Google Form, but have not received an invite from Paycom yet? ->
completion: You will receive an invite from Pacyom in the following days. If you got your SSN, but did not receive it until then, email the student payroll. END

prompt: Should I fill out the WS Google Form to submit my hours for Work Study, if I have applied/ can apply for an SSN? ->
completion: No, you do not need to submit hours in the WS Google Form. WS Google Form is only for students who do not have an SSN, and cannot apply for an SSN. END

prompt: What should I upload for the I-9 Document Requirement? ->
completion:
Please refer to this resource for further information. List A documents are prefered. For US citizens, they only need to upload their passport, whereas for international students multiple documents are necessary. For all international students, you should merge the following documents in a single PDF format. You can use the tool here to do that. The documents that you need to merge and upload in PAYCOM are: 1) the bio page of your foreign passport, 2) your most recent I-94, and 3) your most recent I-20. Again, you should upload ALL three documents as a single PDF by following the instructions below.

1) go to “DOCUMENTS”, 2) click “ADD DOCUMENT”, and 3) select “Upload I9 Documents” from the drop-down, 4) click “NEXT”, and 5) upload the merged file with the documents mentioned above in a).

 END

prompt: What countries are part of Paycom’s Denylist and need a VPN to work? ->
completion:
You will need a VPN if you are working remotely or logging into Paycom from one of the countries below. In case you need a VPN, contact studentypayroll@minerva.edu for support.

Russia
China
Taiwan
Nigeria
Iran
Syria
Turkey
Brazil
Hungary
Romania END

prompt: Where can I find a resource to obtain my Public IP address? ->
completion: Please refer to the linked resource. END

prompt: I am currently living outside of the United States and cannot fill my Paycom Onboarding Checklist with a non-US address, what should I do? ->
completion: For students living outside of the United States, please use The Turk Residence address: 16 Turk Street, San Francisco, CA 94102. END

prompt: I do not have a working US Phone Number at the moment and Paycom requires one for Two-Factor authentication/Emergency Contact. What should I do? ->
completion:
There are two alternatives:

If you are asking about the initial onboarding process, you must have an active US phone number in order to start the onboarding process. We can delete that number once you get fully onboarded if you face issues with the Two-Factor authentication.

If, after you have been already fully onboarded in Paycom, you still need to enter a US phone number, please use the phone number of Minerva University’s Office Headquarters: 415-649-7658. Make sure you set it as a Work Number. Students should not need to verify this number. If you are still experiencing difficulty, please send an email to studentypayroll@minerva.edu with screenshots when possible. END

prompt: What should I add to the Expiration Date of Employment Authorization? ->
completion: For International Students, The Expiration Date of Employment Authorization is the expiration date of your VALID F-1 Visa. U.S. Citizens and Permanent Residents should add their Expected Graduation Date if required. END

prompt: Where can I find the Paycom training video? ->
completion: Watch this video training. Password: 1S*.4474 END

prompt: Where can I find the Paycom Resource Manual? ->
completion: Please refer to this resource. END

prompt: I started my work-study position early or mid August, when will my first paycheck be deposited? ->
completion: The first pay date for Work Study is October 2nd, 2020. For further information, please check the Calendar. END

prompt: I started my work-study position early or mid August, when will my first paycheck be deposited? ->
completion: The first pay date for Work Study is October 2nd, 2020. For further information, please check the Calendar https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1qKoOsemna39FxwZMLZq-jjgFOikCe3TAboJKOpfz_fw/edit#gid=0. END

completion: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1_4db-j6gX0zkyJvpkqDIBW3o4cwo_CSA_YnOvDzLr28/edit?usp=sharing END

prompt: Where can I find the Onboarding checklist? ->
completion: Please send an email to mailto:studentypayroll@minerva.kgi.edu for support. END

prompt: I followed the steps on the Paycom training manual but cannot find a timesheet, where can I find this? ->
completion: Please send an email to mailto:studentypayroll@minerva.kgi.edu for support. END

prompt: I see a larger than expected deduction in my payments, what does this mean? ->
completion: Paycom has an automated tax withholding calculator we are unable to modify. The calculator takes the gross income for a given pay period and assumes this will be the recurrent bi-weekly income. Based on this assumption, it estimates the yearly income and assigns your pay period income to a specific tax bracket based on the estimated gross annual income. Therefore, the more hours you report in a specific pay period, the higher the percentage of your gross income that will be withheld as taxes. Withheld amounts can be refunded after submitting your taxes in the following year. We thus strongly recommend you to never forget to report your hours for a long period of time. Your tax deductions might surprise you! Nevertheless, you can be confident that your tax return will return all the exceeding deductions. END

prompt: I can’t find my department on Paycom. How do I know which one of the options in the drop-down menu is my department? ->
completion: When submitting your hours, there's no need to select the department. It will automatically link it to your department according to your job role. The option of selecting the department is only for students who are assigned projects while working with another department. END

prompt: I forgot to add my hours for a specific pay period OR I could not add hours from previous Pay Periods for some reasons and now it does not allow me to add hours to previous Pay Periods. Can I add them to the current/next pay period? ->
completion: Yes, even though your total hours reported for that pay period will be over 15 hours, you can add them as catch up payments. To do that, just add them to the following pay period and comment on where these hours come from. This will help your manager know the origin of these extra hours. Keep in mind the average hours worked per week should be 7.5 END

prompt: My timecard in Paycom is highlighted in yellow and I can’t add more hours. Can I still update my hours? ->
completion: When your timecard is highlighted in yellow, it means it was approved by the employee. To revoke the approval, follow the steps described [here](https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/SxT1gw END

prompt: How do I reset my password/login information? ->
completion: If you forgot your login info to Paycom, including username or password, you can send an email to mailto:studentpayroll@minerva.edu asking about your username or resetting your password. END

prompt: My timecard on Paycom is highlighted as green/blue. Can I still update my hours? ->
completion: Timecards highlighted in blue were already approved by your manager. Please contact him/her/them directly and ask them to follow the steps in the answer to question 21 on this FAQ document to revoke their approval. Make sure you also revoke employee approval if needed (Please see question 21). Finally, ensure everyone has resubmitted their approvals before the deadline. END

prompt: I am unsure about what my department and/or project is when entering hours in Paycom. What should I select? ->
completion: Please leave these sections blank, and it will be assigned to your default department/project. However, the only case when you need to enter your department/project is if you worked as a “course tester” or you have an external position. END

prompt: I am preparing my taxes for 2021 and I was wondering what type of employer Minerva Project and Minerva Institute are? ->
completion: Minerva Project is a company, while Minerva Institute is a non-profit organization. END

prompt: Where can I go if I have further questions? ->
completion: Email Student Payroll at mailto:studentpayroll@minerva.edu. END

prompt: Where can I see if the payment has been made for the hours I entered in Paycom. How can I access my pay stubs? ->
completion: Log in to your Paycom account. Go to Payroll. Click View Stubs. There you can see the breakdown of your payment for each pay period. END
